Questions.QuestionString: 1. Spongy brakes are usually a result of. (Level 1)
2. At what temperature does a yellow fuse plug melt at?. (Level 1)
3. Aquaplaning' can be reduced by. (Level 1)
4. A Maxaret is used in what system?. (Level 1)
5. Nose wheel steering in a modern aircraft is by. (Level 1)
Answers: C. a separate pilot operated control.

Questions.QuestionString: 6. Ribbed tyres with marker tie bars may be worn to. (Level 1)
Answers: A. the top of the tie bar.
B. the base of the tie bar.
C. 1 mm from the rib base.

Questions.QuestionString: 7. A modulator is fitted in conjunction with. (Level 1)
8. When the landing gear is locked up, the cockpit indicator shows. (Level 1)
9. Tyre creep could be caused by. (Level 1)
10. Un-mounted tubeless tyres must be stored. (Level 1)
11. Tubeless tyres are stored. (Level 2)
Answers: B. horizontally maximum of four high with smallest diameter tyre on top.

Questions.QuestionString: 12. Over inflated tyres may cause damage to the. (Level 1)
13. A badly corroded and pitted brake disk will. (Level 2)
Answers: A. wear brake pads too quickly, and should be replaced.
B. be serviceable, and provide better grip.
C. produce a loss of fluid.

Questions.QuestionString: 14. The type of fluid in an oleo strut will depend upon. (Level 2)
Answers: A. type of fluid most readily available.
B. the type of seal material.
C. heat generated in operation of the system.

Questions.QuestionString: 15. A restrictor valve. (Level 2)
Answers: A. speed up the flow in one direction.
B. may be used to slow down undercarriage extension.
C. restrict the extent of travel of the undercarriage.

Questions.QuestionString: 16. The function of the oil in a shock absorber is to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. ensure the separator does not bottom.

Questions.QuestionString:
17. "After MLG down and securely locked, a red light is illuminated the flight
deck. The possible causes are." (Level 2)
18. When checking for alignment of a MLG, check. (Level 2)
19. A green/grey dot marking on aircraft tyre casing represents. (Level 2)
Answers: B. the light part of the tyre.

Questions.QuestionString: 20. Fuse plugs in aircraft tyres are. (Level 2)
Answers: C. to deflate the tyre before removal.

Questions.QuestionString: 21. A breaker strip in an aircraft tyre is. (Level 2)
Answers: B. to provide a wear indication.
C. to indicate the position for tyre levers.

Questions.QuestionString: 22. If fluid leaks along with air whilst oleo charging, this is. (Level 2)
Answers: A. caused by a leaky seal.
C. due to excessive charging pressure.

Questions.QuestionString: 23. How much oxygen is in a tyre (as a maximum)?. (Level 1)

24. On selection of MLG down, the gear extends then begins to retract again. The
cause is. (Level 2)
Answers: C. gear lowered at too high an airspeed.

Questions.QuestionString:
25. When an undercarriage is lowered, it tends to creep back up. The fault could
be. (Level 2)
26. What is tyre creep related to?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. Horizontal movement of the tyre.
B. Vertical movement of the tyre.
C. Tyre moving around the wheel.

Questions.QuestionString: 27. What decides the type of oil used in an undercarriage leg?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. The material of the leg.
B. The types of seals the leg uses.
C. Neither, any oil can be used.

Questions.QuestionString: 28. In an anti-skid system. (Level 2)
Answers: A. brakes are modulated to give most efficient braking.
B. brakes release on rising torque.
C. brakes release on falling torque.

Questions.QuestionString:
29. If an undercarriage oleo has insufficient deflection, the likely cause is. (Level
2)
30. If the shuttle valve was stuck in the normal position. (Level 2)
Answers: A. neither system will be available.
B. emergency braking will not be available.
C. normal braking will not be available.

Questions.QuestionString: 31. The breaker strip of a tyre is fitted. (Level 2)
Answers: A. between the apex strip and the casing piles.
B. between the bead and the casing piles.
C. between the tread rubber and the casing piles.

Questions.QuestionString:
32. Excessive wear in the shoulder area of an aircraft tyre is an indication of.
(Level 2)
33. On large aircraft, bogie type undercarriages are used to. (Level 2)
Answers: A. spread the weight over a large area.

Questions.QuestionString: 34. A tyre specification 32 x 10.75-14. What does the 10.75 refer to. (Level 1)

35. To position the bogie beam at a suitable angle for retraction and landing, a.
(Level 2)

36. On large aircraft, braked wheel assemblies are normally inflated with. (Level
2)
Answers: B. an argon and CO2 mixture.
C. nitrogen and not more than 5% of air.

Questions.QuestionString: 37. Brake deboosters. (Level 2)
Answers: A. increase the hydraulic pressure entering the brakes.
B. reduce the hydraulic pressure entering the brakes.
C. assist the operation of the anti-skid unit.

Questions.QuestionString: 38. A brake debooster valve is provided for. (Level 3)
Answers: A. applying brake pressure slowly and releasing the the brakes quickly.
B. increasing the pressure and applying the brakes rapidly.
C. decreasing the pressure and slowly releasing the brakes.

Questions.QuestionString: 39. On a wheel bogie unit, positive camber is when the. (Level 3)
Answers: A. bottom of the wheels are closer together.
B. top of the wheels are closer together.
C. front of the wheels are closer together.

Questions.QuestionString:
40. When servicing an oleo, fluid comes out of the air valve when the leg is
depressurised?. (Level 3)
Answers: A. The leg is serviceable - the separator has bottomed.

Questions.QuestionString: 41. The purpose of the flutter plate in a shock absorber is to. (Level 3)
Answers:
A. permit free flow of oil during compression and restriction of oil during
extension.
B. restrict the compression of the air.
C. separate the oil from the air.

Questions.QuestionString: 42. When fitting a tyre, the red dot should be positioned. (Level 3)
Answers: A. on the other side of the wheel opposite to the charging valve.
C. adjacent to the charging valve.

Questions.QuestionString: 43. Composite brake units. (Level 3)
Answers: A. weigh the same as normal brake units and fade away athigh temperatures.
B. have less weight than normal brake units but fade away at high temperatures.

C. have less weight than normal brake units and have increased efficiency at high
temperatures.

Questions.QuestionString: 44. A restrictor valve can be used. (Level 3)
Answers: A. to increase the speed of undercarriage retraction.
B. to increase the speed of the undercarriage extension.
C. to reduce the speed of the undercarriage extension.

Questions.QuestionString: 45. Made up wheels should be stored. (Level 1)
Answers: C. horizontal no more than 4 high.

Questions.QuestionString: 46. The cam plate in a nose undercarriage is. (Level 3)
Answers: A. part of the shimmy damper.
B. to align for nose wheel on nose undercarriage retraction.
C. for alignment of the nose wheel steering on nose undercarriage extension.

Questions.QuestionString: 47. .Why is a hydraulic damper fitted to a nose wheel steering system?. (Level 3)
Answers: A. To reduce vibration and shimmy.
B. To centralise the nose wheel during an up selection.
C. To centralise the nose leg assembly during an up selection.

Questions.QuestionString:
48. The pilot receives an audible warning on the flight deck as the aircraft is
descending to land. The most likely reason for this warning is. (Level 3)
Answers: A. the airspeed is too high.
B. the landing gear is not locked down.
C. the rate of descent is too high.

Questions.QuestionString:
49. A restrictor in the landing gear hydraulic retraction and lowering system is
positioned in the. (Level 3)
Answers: C. return line from the landing gear selector.

Questions.QuestionString: 50. Wheel speed information is used in auto speed brake systems. (Level 3)
Answers: A. to stow the spoilers automatically when the aircraft has nearly stopped.

B. to ensure the aircraft has touched down and to give a slight time lapse before
spoiler deployment.
C. to ensure the aircraft is still rolling.

Questions.QuestionString: 51. A fusible plug fitted to an aircraft wheel prevents. (Level 3)
Answers: A. over inflation of tyres during servicing.

B. brakes seizure, if brake stators and rotors weld together under excessive
temperatures.
C. tyre bursts due to high temperatures created by excessive braking.

Questions.QuestionString: 52. The fusible plugs installed in some aircraft wheel will. (Level 3)
Answers: A. facilitate servicing of the wheel assembly.
B. melt at a specified elevated temperature.
C. eliminate the need to check air pressure

Questions.QuestionString: 53. In the case of pressurized aircraft, the nose-wheel bay. (Level 3)
Answers: A. is pressurized to a value higher than ambient but less than cabin pressure.
B. is subject to cabin pressure.

Questions.QuestionString: 54. The minimum aquaplaning ground speed is. (Level 3)
Answers: A. 9.6 times the root square of the tyre pressure in psi.
B. 8.6 times the root square of the tyre pressure in psi.
C. 8.6 times the tyre pressure in bar.

Questions.QuestionString: 55. Tubed tyres are stored. (Level 3)
Answers: A. horizontally, up to 4 in total staggering them to prevent distortion of beads.

B. horizontally, up to 4 in total in a rack with supporting tubes so each tyre is
supported at 2 points.
C. horizontally, up to 4 in total with the smallest at the top.

Questions.QuestionString:
56. These markings are found on a tyre32 x 10.45 R 14.What does the number 32
mean?. (Level 1)
57. When inflating a tyre and you notice ice in the valve stem. (Level 3)
Answers: A. heat the valve stem gently with a blow torch.
B. wait for ice to melt before carrying on with inflation.
C. carry on inflating as ice in the valve stem is no problem.

Questions.QuestionString: 58. In detachable flange type wheels, the flange is secured by. (Level 1)
59. A red dot / triangle mark on aircraft tyres means. (Level 1)
Answers: B. the light part of the tyre.

Questions.QuestionString: 60. Vents holes are found on. (Level 1)
61. How many LDG with normal aircraft?
62. Why all jet aircraft have a nose wheel LDG than a tail wheel LDG?
63. Where is the CG of the A/C with nose wheel LDG?
Answers: C. In front of main wheels

Questions.QuestionString:
64. Which is the most advantage of A/C with nose wheel LDG than a tail wheel
LDG during landing?
Answers: A. Landing at high speed without nosing over

Questions.QuestionString: 65. Do a jet airplane have a brake in the nose LDG?
Answers: C. Has brakes in all LDGs

Questions.QuestionString: 66. Does nose LGD structure is bigger than main LDG?
67. Where is the location of steering system in some old and slow aircrafts?
68. How many ways to steer A/C on ground (Modern A/C)?
Answers: B. By the Pedal & the Tiller

Questions.QuestionString:
69. Which are the advantages with landing gears and doors retracted during
flight?
Answers:
A. 1. Decrease the noise.
2. Decrease the parasite drag.
3. Give higher airspeed.

B. 2. Decrease the parasite drag.
3. Give higher airspeed.
4. Lower fuel consumption.

C. 1. Decrease the noise.
2. Decrease the parasite drag.
3. Give higher airspeed.
4. Lower fuel consumption.

Questions.QuestionString: 70. What power supply to operate the LDGs (large A/C)?
71. How many ways to extension LDG?
72. What are purpose of the torsion (torque) links?
Answers: A. 1. Permit the inner cylinder to move up and down in the outer cylinder.
B. 2. Not permit the inner cylinder to rotate 90° in the outer cylinder.

C. 1. Permit the inner cylinder to move up and down in the outer cylinder.
2. Not permit the inner cylinder to rotate in the outer cylinder.

Questions.QuestionString: 73. Which components send signal to show LDG down and locked position?

74. For safety reason, what should mechanic do during working in LDG system on
ground?
Answers: B. Installed the LDG safety pin (devices)
C. Checked condition of hydraulic system

Questions.QuestionString:
75. After finishing work on LDG area, which step mechanic must check before
A/C depart?
Answers: A. Installed the LDG safety pins
B. Connected the headset for standby
C. Removed all LDG safety pins

Questions.QuestionString:
76. During Transit check, found hyd leaks over limit from shock struts, no spare,
no time, what should CRS decides to do?
Answers: A. Actives the spare gland seal
